questionText: Independent booksellers have had great difficulty competing against the major chain stores.
author: AOGFK82SQRJY7

questionText: In the 1990s, membership in the American Bookseller Association dropped by almost half.
author: AOGFK82SQRJY7

questionText: In 1997 the independents market share was down to 17%.
author: ABLP1KUWW46S6

questionText: The American Booksellers Association (ABA) represents the independent booksellers of the U.S.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: Adults purchased over 50 million titles online.
author: AYSG3J2U3UF1Y

questionText: Big chains are proliferating and squeezing out independent bookstores.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: 30 million fewer books were purchased in 1998.
author: A2N2GFB33ZMYGF

questionText: Independents lost half their market share in six years and many have closed.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: The ABA was formed to represent and promote the independent booksellers.
author: A3QAETE7C7Z4R3

questionText: One-half of the book sales were generated by major chain stores and electronic bookstores.
author: AYSG3J2U3UF1Y
